summary: This document is an email chain from July 2023 discussing Leon Black's financial settlements related to the Epstein probe. Attorney Jeanne M. Christensen forwards a Reuters article reporting Black paid $62.5 million to the US Virgin Islands and references allegations he sexually assaulted multiple women, urging legal action.

keyFacts: Leon Black paid $62.5 million to the US Virgin Islands as part of a settlement related to the Epstein probe.
The payment to the US Virgin Islands does not include payments to individual women allegedly assaulted by Black.
One lawyer reportedly represents ten women who allege Leon Black sexually assaulted them.
Attorney Jeanne M. Christensen is urging legal authorities to take action against Leon Black based on this new information.
The communication references overlap between the Leon Black matter and the Epstein/Maxwell cases.
